result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel James Nyman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Full Huber.
Concurrent with: Counts 1 and 2 concurrent with each other and with any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel James Nyman

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: 11:01 AM Defendant Daniel James Nyman in court, in custody.  Attorney Kelly J. Freeman in court for Daniel James Nyman.  Attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to counts 1 and 2. Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 and 2. Presentence investigation waived. Court orders 1 years jail on each count concurrent with each other and concurrent with any other sentence. Full Huber. Costs due within 60 days. Sentence credit 85 days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:05 AM Defendant Daniel James Nyman in court, in custody.  Attorney Kelly J. Freeman in court for Daniel James Nyman.  Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on September 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:10 AM Prosecuting attorney Gerald Anthony Urbik in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel James Nyman in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy in court for Daniel James Nyman.  Motion hearing continued. Court grants attorney Murphy's motion to withdraw.  Public Defender's Office to appoint Kelly Freeman.
Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:26 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel James Nyman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy appeared by video for Daniel James Nyman. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads not guilty. Matter to be set.

Activity: Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

4:06 PM Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel James Nyman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson appeared by video for Daniel James Nyman. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Cash bond set of $500.00 with conditions: Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 3PM.
